name: Stream Temperature
functionStatement: Shade, solar input, and groundwater keep temperature and light within natural ranges for stream metabolism and dissolved oxygen.
descriptionMarkdown: Stays within acceptable bounds for local aquatic life, rarely exceeding stress thresholds.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Field

Method: Use continuous or spot water-temperature records to assess maxima and diel range. Use modeled products where monitoring data are absent.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Rarely surpasses local standard or typical seasonal maxima for the stream type.

inputs.label: Stream Temperature
inputs.type: use continuous or spot water-temperature records to assess maxima and diel range. use modeled products where monitoring data are absent.

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Slightly exceeds thresholds occasionally. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Frequently near or above thresholds. / Consistently high or potentially lethal temperatures. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: USGS NWIS and/or EPA Water Quality Portal water temperature data (where available); NorWeST modeled temperatures (where available). (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: USGS NWIS and/or EPA Water Quality Portal water temperature data (where available)
NorWeST modeled stream temperature products (where available).
